thread.title: Margaret Shirley dashed in repeat bid at U.S. Women's Mid-Am
thread.title_full: Margaret Shirley dashed in repeat bid at U.S. Women's Mid-Am

author: The Associated Press (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Margaret Shirley dashed in repeat bid at U.S. Women's Mid-Am
text: Margaret Shirley dashed in repeat bid at U.S. Women's Mid-Am by The Associated Press Associated Press October 09, 2015 12:27 AM | 0 views | 0 | 0 | | Margaret Shirley and caddie William Shirley — her father — react after a missed birdie putt on the 11th hole of Thursday’s final. USGA - Matt Sullivan slideshow CHOUDRANT, La. — Lauren Greenlief won the U.S. Women’s Mid-Amateur on Thursday, beating defending champion Margaret Shirley 2 and 1 at Squire Creek.The 25-year-old Greenlief, from Oakton, Virginia, became the youngest winner in the history of the event limited to players 25 and older. The former Virginia player is a management consultant.“It’s the coolest feeling ever,” Greenlief said. “I think every golfer, especially every amateur golfer, really dreams of being a USGA champion, because it’s really the pinnacle of amateur golf. To get my name etched on the trophy forever is something that I know will be a highlight of my golf career.”Greenlief made a 35-foot birdie putt on the par-5 17th and won the match when Shirley missed a 13-footer.The 29-year-old Shirley, a Lassiter High School product who lives in Roswell, was making her record third straight appearance in the final. She lost to Julia Potter in 2013 at Biltmore Forest in North Carolina, then beat Potter last year at Harbour Trees in Indiana.The former Auburn player is the executive director of Atlanta Junior Golf.“When you’re 3 down after five, to try to battle back on a golf course like this when someone is not making any mistakes, it’s hard,” Shirley said. “She’s a phenomenal player, just a great champion, great girl and I had a lot of fun out there. It was a great match. That’s all you can hope for.” Share This Article | similar stories
